# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(text, r"(\s+|[\.?!])\s*") # Split text into words and punctuation marks
    lines = String[]
    current_line = ""

    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = ""
        end
        current_line *= word * " " # Add space after word
    end

    # Add last line
    if length(current_line) > 0
        push!(lines, current_line)
    end

    join(lines, "\n") # Join lines into a single string with newline characters
end

# Example usage
wrap_string("The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog. The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog. The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.")
```

Output:

```
"The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.\nThe quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.\nThe quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog."
```
